qas.question: What city contains some of the finest and oldest museums in all of China?
What is the previous name of the Nanjing Museum?
Which museum was the first modern one in China?
What collections are the Nanjing Museum famous for?
How many items does the Nanjing Museum contain?

context: <a0_0>Nanjing<a0_0/> has some of the oldest and finest museums in China. <a2_0>Nanjing Museum<a2_0/>, formerly known as <a1_0>National Central Museum<a1_0/> during ROC period, is the first modern museum and remains as one of the leading museums in China having <a4_0>400,000 items<a4_0/> in its permanent collection,. The museum is notable for enormous collections of <a3_0>Ming and Qing imperial porcelain<a3_0/>, which is among the largest in the world. Other museums include the City Museum of Nanjing in the Chaotian Palace, the Oriental Metropolitan Museum, the China Modern History Museum in the Presidential Palace, the Nanjing Massacre Memorial Hall, the Taiping Kingdom History Museum, Jiangning Imperial Silk Manufacturing Museum, Nanjing Yunjin Museum, Nanjing City Wall Cultural Museum, Nanjing Customs Museum in Ganxi House, Nanjing Astronomical History Museum, Nanjing Paleontological Museum, Nanjing Geological Museum, Nanjing Riverstones Museum, and other museums and memorials such Zheng He Memorial, Jinling Four Modern Calligraphers Memorial.
